definition: ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions

sentences.english: I'm going to buy a monthly ticket tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 我打算明天去买一张月票。

sentences.english: Inside there is some money, IP card and a monthly ticket.
sentences.chinese: 里面装有一些钱，一张IP卡和一张月票。

sentences.english: I had my purse and commutation ticket stolen while I was sleeping in the train.
sentences.chinese: 当我在火车上睡觉时，我的钱包和月票被偷了。

sentences.english: You can pick one up at virtually any transit station.
sentences.chinese: 所有中转站几乎都可以买到月票。

sentences.english: The monthly ticket is valid for a month only.
sentences.chinese: 月票有效期只有一个月。

sentences.english: My season ticket will expire this week.
Passengers without a monthly pass can purchase tickets from coin-operated ticket dispensers.
sentences.chinese: 没有月票的乘客直接到无人售票机前投币购票。

sentences.english: She commutes to work every day.
sentences.chinese: 她每天使用月票上下班。

sentences.english: Please show me your monthly bus pass.
sentences.chinese: 请出示年夜家汽车月票。

sentences.english: Please exhibit me your monthly bus pass.
There is some money, a monthly ticket and something else in it.
sentences.chinese: 里面有一些钱，一张月票和其它物品。

definition: first of the five night watch periods 19:00-21:00 (old)
to reward/to tip/to give a gratuity
to cheer on (originally esp. as paid stooge)/to root for sb/to sing sb's praises/to flatter
to be generous (idiom)/to be magnanimous/Give me a break!
to help/to do a favor/(Shanghainese) Come on!/Give me a break!
